abstract: How to keep your bookmarks, cookies and passwords the same across the different computers you use.
snippet: How to keep your bookmarks, cookies and passwords the same across the different computers you use.
lead_paragraph: If you use Firefox and want to keep your bookmarks, cookies and passwords the same across the different computers you use, there is a far easier way than periodically exporting and importing a file composed of your bookmarks. The free Google Browser Sync can keep all your machines up to date. You need a Google account or a Gmail address for it to work. Google has complete installation and setup instructions at www.google.com/tools/firefox/browsersync, along with a link to download the application.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Managing Bookmarks and Passwords
